categories.title: Recent Merges and Refactors in ElizaOS Repository

content.text: Several branches have been merged into 'develop', including 'pr/CryptoGraffe/2307', '1186-add-get-memories-by-ids', 'pr/1865', 'character-from-url', 'refactor-farcaster-client', and 'pr/augchan42/2248'. These merges indicate ongoing development and feature integration.
A major refactor was performed on the web search functionality, turning it into a service. This was merged from 'refactor-websearch' into the main branch.
A new feature was added to support loading characters from a URL, merged from 'character-from-url'.
Multiple updates were made to the 'eternalai-agent' branch, including merging changes from 'develop' and resolving conflicts in '.env.example'.
A fix was applied to correct the 'OPENROUTER_API_KEY' environment variable in the configuration.
The Farcaster client environment configuration was refactored, with multiple merges into 'develop'.

A variety of new plugins and improvements have been introduced to ElizaOS, enhancing its functionality and expanding its capabilities. Notable updates include the addition of the Rooch plugin, Dex Screener plugin, and an improved Solana plugin for seamless transactions. The Solana plugin now features a dedicated character, SBF, to handle Solana-based transactions, with improved logging and transaction state monitoring.

A new Ad Network Plugin has been introduced, allowing agents to generate promotional content for airdrop tokens. This plugin, developed by the Vader AI team, provides insights into airdropped tokens and enables seamless marketing integration.

The Metaplex Bubblegum plugin has been added, enabling agents to interact with Solana's compressed NFT (cNFT) protocol. This feature allows for minting, transferring, and updating metadata of cNFTs, along with retrieving asset details.

A new 0x plugin is in development, though it is still a work in progress. Additionally, improvements have been made to the Dex Screener plugin, adding functionality to fetch trending, boosted, and newly listed tokens.
A reported issue regarding an 'Invalid Schema' error when creating tokens has been raised, indicating a need for schema validation in the plugin development process.
A feature request has been made to allow ServiceType to be extended without modifying the core package, making it easier for developers to add new services without altering the core codebase.

The cryptocurrency market has seen fluctuations in the prices of major assets. Wrapped Bitcoin (WBTC) increased from $96,293.01 to $100,196.82, showing a notable rise. Similarly, Solana (SOL) moved from $187.43 to $205.88, and Wrapped Ethereum (WETH) climbed from $3,223.66 to $3,449.15. The ai16z token also experienced an increase, rising from $1.38 to $1.57.
@DecryptMedia warns 'Never goon'.
@___hounds discusses efficiency in decision-making, emphasizing the importance of note-taking to avoid miscommunication, comparing it to a game of telephone.
@UncleHODL shares multiple links without additional context.
@eliza_studios asks for a price with 'just tell me how much'.
@elizawakesup inquires about a relationship status with a sad emoji.
A vague statement from an unidentified user: 'I'll just drop this here...'.

categories.title: Emerging Innovations in AI and Technology

content.text: Interest is growing around AI and blockchain projects, with various contributors and organizations engaging in discussions.

New AI hardware is making waves—priced at $3,000 and set for release in May, it can reportedly run 405 billion parameter models at home when two units are chained together. This development is seen as a major step forward for local-first open-source AI.
Excitement is building around what teams like APRO_Oracle and zkTLSlabs will create with new advancements in AI and cryptographic technologies.
Robotics is becoming a key focus, with growing enthusiasm for real-world applications.
A discussion on the evolution of VR/AR highlights the importance of building infrastructure that aligns with cultural shifts and can endure until the technology reaches its final form.

categories.title: Eliza Contributor Leaderboard Update & Documentation Improvements

content.text: A new preview of the Eliza contributor leaderboard has been released, featuring navigation for skill cards, a daily summary with date navigation, URL-based skill filtering, and enhanced content display. This update aims to make open-source contributions feel more like an MMORPG, allowing users to see who does what on a repository.
Several updates have been made to the Eliza repository's documentation. These include removing duplicate content from the README file and adding a WSL 2 link to the Turkish README.

categories.title: Advancements in Agent Frameworks and Onchain Transformation

content.text: The new v2 core, developed by @bmgalego, introduces a robust framework for building lightweight, production-ready agents. It is designed to be accessible for beginners while offering advanced capabilities for experienced developers.

A key feature of v2 is the ability to dynamically import context providers and actions at runtime. This allows agents to write, execute, and share new code in real-time, significantly enhancing their flexibility and adaptability.

Current agent technology serves as a human interface to traditional tools and APIs, lowering the barrier to entry and improving accessibility. The existing infrastructure is solid, but many users are unaware of its capabilities.

The Onchain Agent Transformer enables the transformation of Eliza agents into Solidity smart contracts deployed across multiple blockchains. This makes them censorship-resistant, tamper-proof, and permanently accessible. Eternal AI currently supports over 14 blockchains for this transformation.
A new feature has been added to the database adapters, allowing retrieval of memories by their IDs.

Fixes and improvements have been made to the SwapAction functionality in the evm-plugin. The update includes bug fixes and the addition of Bebop dex-aggregator as an alternative for swaps. The SwapAction now selects the best quote across multiple dex-aggregators and executes using the best available option, with fallback mechanisms in case of failure.

Support for multiple remote character URLs has been enabled. Users can now start the server with or without character parameters, and remote characters will load accordingly. This update expands on a previous pull request and addresses issue #2252.
A draft example has been created to demonstrate how to use strace for debugging boot failures of Eliza in a Docker environment.

categories.title: New Features in AI Code and Prompt Tools

content.text: A new tool, 'code2prompt,' allows users to generate prompts from their project code. It supports token counting, price estimation, and works with OpenAI's GPT-4 model.
Support for the EternalAI provider has been added, enabling retrieval of on-chain system prompts.
